title: I don't know why so many people treat this game like it's life and death
body:
This game has basically 0 impact on your life unless you're in the top 0.1% of the playerbase and get recruited to a pro team which most people are not.  If you are only playing to win, then that means you are only having fun about 50% of the time.  Losing a game isn't the end of the world.  Going into a game with the goal of winning is a good thing, but if that's all that matters to you then you shouldn't be playing a game like this.  I'd rather enjoy spending 20 - 40 minutes of my life having fun, rather than stressing out about winning the game.  If someone is trolling or flaming you does it really matter?  You only have to deal with them for another 20 minutes and then you can move on and get into another game.  Getting mad about it and crying won't solve the problem and will just waste your time.

End rant.

Simple answer. Passion and investment. 

Think about it, are there any other activities you partake in that get you steamed up if you fail? Like I said, passion and investment. It can make something feel like the most important thing in the world, _**especially **_ in the heat of the moment. 

Chances are most people once they've calmed down after the fact, look back at themselves and realise "Phew, I got really worked up there" and have a little laugh at themselves....well that's what I do anyway :P
Once you escape the realms of victory at all costs because nothing else matters you have truly found the only way to defeat League.

Because the game is a very competitive one.  On top of that, the time invested into getting half-way decent at the game is not insubstantial.  When someone invests their time into something, it's a deep seated human need to see a reward for time invested:  See: Relationships, Careers (IE: raises for performance, seniority, etc) because OUR time is limited on larger scale.  
On the other side of your argument, if you want people to not take it seriously maybe there shouldn't be ranked?  There is a serious element to the game, it's part of what makes it popular.
